Author: thecalcographer
Text: A BMI of 17.5 or below used to be a criteria for anorexia, but not all people with an underweight BMI qualify for an anorexia diagnosis. The people in the 18.4-17.6 range just didn’t meet the requirements for an anorexia diagnosis, but that doesn’t mean their health isn’t in trouble due to being underweight or that they’re not struggling with another ED.

Author: algorthin
Text: I was diagnosed with anorexia when I was just barely underweight (like 18.3 or 18.4 bmi). Of course I had also lost 80+ pounds in 5 months, but I don't think 17.5 as the criteria necessarily holds fast in an actual treatment setting, it depends a lot more on your specific symptoms.
